resources.string: BMI less than 18.5 : Individuals in this category may have a higher risk of health problems due to being underweight, such as malnutrition, weakened immune system, and osteoporosis.
BMI between 18.5 and 24.9 : Individuals in this category are generally considered to have a healthy weight range. They have a lower risk of developing weight-related health problems.
BMI between 25 and 29.9 : Individuals in this category may have a higher risk of developing health problems such as heart disease, high blood pressure, and type 2 diabetes.
BMI 30 or greater :Individuals in this category have a significantly higher risk of developing serious health problems, including heart disease, stroke, type 2 diabetes, and certain types of cancer.

Always consult a healthcare professional for personalized health assessments, recommendations regarding weight management, and to receive a comprehensive evaluation of your health status beyond just the BMI category.
